title: PvP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working
body: When I tried to open the client to log in this morning, a message popped up saying, "PvP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working." What should I do to fix this? I was able to login yesterday, but for some reason I cannot login today. Please help!

replies.body:
League not being assigned the right system permissions is usually the cause of Patcher Kernel errors. Because League interacts with a lot of files and software packages outside of the League folder, it's important that your Operating System grants it the right permissions to access those items. Our [permissions guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) will walk you through the most common solutions for this. 

Let me know if you continue to have issues after working through that guide.
Thank you so much for looking into the issue for me! I didn't realize there was an update for Windows 10. I installed the update, and League is working again.
